ratings.comment: The course is very exam-heavy, with the midterm counting for 30% and the final 50% of the grade. However, the professor provides practice problems before each exam, and the actual test questions are very similar. Thus, it's important to take them seriously. Grading is very generous, and frequent bonus points help balance the course difficulty.
Awful Professor, her exam is extremely hard. And she give terrible lectures.

The most dry lectures I've ever been to. I've never struggled in math EVER until having her for STAT 310. Doesn't record lectures or post lecture slides so there is no way to review what was covered in class. No practice exams were provided either. Entire grade is based solely on Midterm (30%) and Final (50%). Avoid at all costs.

Her notetaking is clear, which is analogous to the textbook- if you read the textbook, mainly focusing on formulas, then take the lecture, you will easily get an A. Her email response is quick among the professors I've ever experienced with, which was helpful for the exam. Practice exam is a lot related to the actual exams.
Somehow made the class harder than it actually is.
Worst professor ever. she read everything from the textbook and cannot explain things clearly. Exams are harder than the homework. Avoid her class at all cost.
She is the most dry, confusing lecturer ive had.  She takes so many long pauses when speaking.  Her notes are a mess and hard to follow.  Do not recommend.  Homework is difficult.
worst professor ever

Read books and copy books without proving anything other than super easy things.

Haphazard noting and capricious speaking

Professor An does have a rather dry lecture style, but she is efficient at teaching the course contents and provides many examples to help students understand it during lecture. She is also very approachable during and outside of class, and very helpful in her office hours and through email. Class was primarily graded on a fair midterm and final.
Professor An is very responsible and has well-prepared lectures. She gave us lots of help during the office hour.
Do not recommend. Avoid at all costs.

The professor was so arrogant and rude that she refused to answer questions on the piazza and refused to release the exam key. Except for the lecture, the entire class is basically run by TA. In addition, this course does not have curve
This lecturer is basically reading the textbook.

She just follows the textbook during lecture if you have it open and not actually teaching anything. I found it better to just skip class and read the textbook myself. Practice exam for the final exam had an insane number of errors on it that needed to be corrected up to the day before the exam. Exams never represented what was emphasized in class.
Avoid her at all cost, her exams are insane !!!

The worst professor I have had. She shows the skills for a great statistics researcher, but clearly lacks the ability to teach it. Her accent just adds insult to injury. Before taking this class, I didn't believe the other reviews, and this was the my biggest mistake ever. It is worth it to be late a semester and not take this class with this her.

Doesn't give actual numerical examples in this class which prepared me poorly for the midterm. Lectures are very dull and dry. Her lecture notes are unorganized and hard to follow at times. The few coding examples taken from her own source code aren't shared with us. If you can, avoid her.

Worst prof @ UW so far. Lectures not worth your time; I understand the words that leave her mouth but nothing makes sense. The lec notes are messy sample probs w/ no actual info. She half-explains concepts w/o writing them down. Textbook bad & from the 80s, but I had to rely on it. Homework is difficult & the final brought tears to many eyes. Avoid

Lectures are pretty much useless - GENUINELY just skip it and read the textbook. Her lectures are just a blabbering mess and homework is difficult. I did well on the midterm because of her review but this final will screw me over. Taking this for ActSci so Exam P will be a self-study. DO NOT take this class, worst professor at UW for far.
Good class!

Stat311 is not very hard but students definitely need to pay more attention on the dry concepts of statistics. I think one big reason why final is hard is that students need to calculate probability with integral knowledge learned from math234. And without calculators, figuring out integral is not an easy thing.

Oh my god do not take 349 with her. She has no idea what's going on, and her lectures are just meaningless, incomprehensible blabbering where she messily scribbles the entire time. She pulls everything from the textbook and the homework questions are insanely difficult. Also the prereqs for this class do not prepare you by any means.
easy homework and midterm, extremely difficult final.

Lectures are clear. Each definition is followed by some examples. You can get enough exercises based on class examples, textbooks and homework. She also gives extra practice before the final exam. Although the final is hard, she is a nice grader.
Easy homework and extremely difficult final exam.
The lecture was very boring.
Very boring Professor overall. Easy midterm and homework, extremely difficult final. Avoid at all costs.
Plain and dry
The exams calculator requirement just annoyed me so much. Also not a lot supports.

An is a decent prof, not someone you should actively avoid nor actively try to get a class with. Her lectures are alright, educational if not a little dry, and her hw and exams are fair. I wish she offered practice exams. Overall her class feels very rigid, grading is not generous, examples in lecture aren't relatable, etc, but you will learn stats

Panduan had amazing lectures and the study sheets she gave out before exams virtually ensured you got a 100% if you put in the effort to study off of them. Anything I was confused on she easily cleared up in office hours. Really the only criticism is tests probably should have been monitored better, lots of students were blatantly cheating.

She's a great prof, immediately the first day I liked her. She breaks things down really well in lecture, however it can get kind of drug out. Her tests are just like the problems you go over in lecture. She gives previous exams and answer keys, and additional practice problems and solutions. If you do the work and notes, the class is a breeze.

I don't know why her score is too low. She is really a good professor. From this semester's learning, I really learned a lot from her. She teaches every one with patience. She combines concepts with examples. It makes you have a better understanding about what you learn. I really love her teaching style.

Took this class online during the covid response, I get some professors don't want to post answer keys as they re-use tests, but not only could we not see the correct answers or how we were graded, we didn't even have access to the test questions when reviewing our grades. Lectures hard to follow, don't bother just go to discussion and read txtbk.

Professor An barely describes questions in her own lectures, tests biweekly, and does not answer questions well (even when asked in office hours). I don't know how the classes compare, but if you're taking 309 for (Act Sci) SOA Exam P, be prepared to have to teach yourself more than you rely on lectures. She's the worst professor I've had at UW.

It's pretty true that Professor An is a super tough grader and that she is super lecture heavy. However, she WILL help you if you ask and email her in person. I'm ngl, my grade in this class is not the best, but she dedicated a lot of time outside of class to help me and even answered my super stupid questions. Hate her class, i like her tho
She does not answer questions directly so you must figure things out by yourself. Her hws and exams are not easy. Can't imagine why she's so tough even under such a situation, a pandemic.

Uploads hours upon hours of lectures in which she basically reads a powerpoint of 30+ slides and does simple/basic examples. Biweekly assessments that do not reflect the homework or the lecture examples, in fact are sometimes much harder. If you have to take this class, wait how many semesters it takes until they get a better professor to teach it.
Actually the worst professor I've had at UW, with distinction.
Biweekly exams, boring lectures, awful explanations. Don't get this professor unless you have to.

Actually the worst professor I have had at UW. She just reads from the lecture notes and never answers questions directly. I had to teach myself everything before the exams. Cannot recommend not taking her class more.
Very clear lectures full of examples. You will need to take a lot of notes to be able to do your homework. Lecture is fun if you are interested in the topics
Very clear lectures. Solved practice problems in class that closely resembled exam material. Second exam was disproportionately harder than the first, but it was curved generously.

Avoid her at any cost!!! I learned nothing from her class. Her English is hard to understand. Exams are way harder than practice and she is such a tough grader. She curves two identical classes differently instead of in the same pool. I am unlucky to join the class with a higher average score, so there is about no curve. Her class sucks!

lectures are very loaded--we are talking about sore fingers from taking notes here. lecs go very fast, hardly give students some time to think. you will just be busy trying to keep up with the notes. taking notes in class is just copying what the prof writes on board, which she also posts on canvas, so taking notes at home is basically the same.
Her practice exams are misleading. The exam is always harder. Also a very boring lecturer.
i learned N O T H I N G

Lectures are useless. Literally just reading out of the textbook with little elaboration and no questions from students. Exams suck - material isn't that hard but the practice exams/study guides were never even close to the actual exam content. Exams are always way harder than the study problems.

Professor An's lecture is really boring, all she does is copy the textbook material, and she barely explains anything. Not really helpful when asking her a question because most of the time she can't explain it well. The worst thing was that she was not consistent on her exam policies, and her exams' difficulty could really differ from the practice

Panduan is not a native English tongue, so she is hard to understand in lecture. She reads off formulas and definitions for an hour and 15 minutes every Tuesday and Thursday and puts the class to sleep within the first five. She doesn't explain things well and generally doesn't teach things well either. Do not take this class with her. Worst prof

Never take her class!! she is the worst. She just reads and copies the book as her note during the lecture. her english is awful. Not even consider you can understand what she is saying during the class. she cannot teach.
OMG dont even get me started with her
No matter what your circumstance is, do not take a class with this professor.
DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. PERIOD.

If you are gonna take Exam P and Stat 309 is suggested, don't take it with Panduan. You are better off taking Stat 311. She won't help you with anything. I can't speak for the other 309 professors but I am done with this class and it has not helped me one bit for exam P
ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE, AVOID AT ALL COSTS. SHE GIVES NO EXPLANATIONS AND DOES NOT HELP WITH ANYTHING.
Don't take her class. She is terrible in all aspects. Taught me absolutely nothing. I think I am stupider after I leave her class.

Attending lectures is next to pointless. She simply just takes problems from the textbook and writes them on the board with little to no explanation. If you need a quiet place to nap for about an hour, her lecture is the place to be. The material is fairly easy. Only complaint is that the real test is wayyy harder than the practice tests she makes.
